post.summary: Creates a new edition of an app
Deletes an edition

Gets the billing ID for an edition

Gets multiple draft editions from a single app
Gets multiple editions for many apps

Lists all of the published editions for an app
Lists all the editions and their marketing material for the app
Updates an existing edition of an app
Updates multiple editions of an app
Upsert creates a new marketing info or inserts against an existing marketing info
Make the addon discoverable in marketplace
ApproveApp approves an app so it can be distributed to our customers.

Checks to see if a group of apps can be activated
see docs for the `AppRequirement` message, for product requirement and child add-on rules
CreateApp creates a marketplace app
Deletes a marketplace app

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: request message structure for deleting an app.

post.summary: Duplicate an existing app (into a draft state)
Returns a specific addon for the specified app
Get a marketplace app
Get the unpublished version of a marketplace app
Gets the AppID related to a sku(billing_id)

Before an app is deactivated check to see if any apps are dependant on the app being deactivated
see docs for the `AppRequirement` message, for product requirement and child add-on rules
Get AppIDS for apps with unpublished changes
GetMulti returns a list of Marketplace Apps. Guaranteed to be returned in the same order. The list will contain an empty value (null) when the app does not exist
Get the unpublished versions of Marketplace Apps via their id. The list will contain an empty value (null) when the app does not exist
GetMulti order forms for the given app_ids

Get a marketplace product cost
DEPRECATED: This RPC has been deprecated and should no longer be used
Get the public keys for the specified app
Get the URL's needed to complete the SSO process for the specified app
Returns a list of addons for the specified app

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: ListAddonsRequest is issued to get multiple addons for a product.

post.summary:
List approved addons for the specified app
DEPRECATED: This RPC has been deprecated and should no longer be used
ListApps will returns a list of Marketplace Apps. The apps will be sorted by name by default.
ListAppsForVendorIDs returns a list of Marketplace Apps that belong to any of the provided vendors.
ListRequiredAppSummaries returns the list of apps that could be required by another app.
PublishApp publishes new changes of the app for the rest of the system to have access to.
Requests a review for a distributed marketplace app
Restores a deleted marketplace app

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: request message structure for restoring deleted app.

post.summary: Suspends a marketplace app

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: request message structure for suspending an app.

post.summary: Make the addon not discoverable in marketplace
UnapproveApp removes an app from being distributed to our customers.
Unsuspends a suspended marketplace app

parameters.description: request message structure for unsuspending a suspended app.

post.summary:
UpdateAppApprovalAndBillingSettings updates the app approval and billing settings.
Used to convert a partner-specifific app to a general marketplace app
Update the end user marketing information for an app
Update the fulfillment integration section of a marketplace app
Update the general section of a marketplace app
Update the integration section of a marketplace app
Update the order form of a marketplace app
Update the reseller marketing information for an app
Update the SSO Integration information
Update the trial configuration information
Updates app's categories

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: request message structure for updating app's categories.

post.summary: AddAppID associates an app to a vendor

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: AddAppIDRequest associates an App to a specified vendor. This is expected to be an uncommon operation.

post.summary: Create initializes a Vendor

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: CreateVendorRequest will make a brand new vendor. To connect apps to a vendor, separate calls must be made.

post.summary: return the vendor associated with the partner asked for
GetMulti returns the vendors asked for
Returns the list of appids that are associated to a partner user
return boolean value if it is a distributed vendor
List returns a paginated list of vendors
RemoveAppID disconnects the specified app from a vendor
Update allows for changing the basic fields on a vendor. This does not allow changes to the vendor's app associations

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: UpdateVendorRequest updates the basic information of a vendor. App Association is expected to be done separately.

post.summary: Returns a list of app pricing data for provided pricing contexts
Upsert updates or inserts a record depending on whether id is provided or not.
Get the configuration for a fulfillment order based on application
Updates the draft configuration for fulfillment orders to what is defined.
GetItemDependencyTree returns the dependency tree of the given item, with the item at the root
GetMultiDependentItems returns the dependencies of the given items
ListActivatableItems lists the items that can be activated by the given seller.
ListDependencies lists the requirements of the given items.
ListOwnedItems lists the items owned by the given owner.
GetMultiAppData gets the data related to each given appId
ListAppIDByMultiTags lists ids of apps that have the specified tags
ListByMultiTag lists tag records that have the specified scope, kind and tag.
ListValuesByMultiKinds lists all the unique value(s) for the given kind(s)
TagApps adds the given tag info for the given app_id(s)
UntagApps removes the given tag info for the given app_id(s)
Singular get given keys
Singular get given keys for an UpgradeDialogContent entity
List AppSettings with paging for particular partner and market
List apps enabled for a partner
Update or Create an AppSettings entity
Create or Update an UpgradeDialogContent entity
GetMultiAuxiliaryData returns specific fields of the custom data associated with a single app (partner scoped)

ListAuxiliaryData lists the custom data associated with the app (partner scoped)
ListAuxiliaryDataRequest object_id refers to the app_id

UpsertAuxiliaryData updates/inserts the custom data associated with the app (partner scoped)
UpsertAuxiliaryDataRequest object_id refers to the app_id

marketplaceappsv1DeliveryMethod.description:
- DELIVERY_METHOD_INVALID: DELIVERY_METHOD_INVALID means the delivery method has not been set
 - DELIVERY_METHOD_PRODUCT: DELIVERY_METHOD_PRODUCT is when the app provides a product to the customer
 - DELIVERY_METHOD_SERVICE: DELIVERY_METHOD_SERVICE is when the app providers a service to the customer

v1Addon.description:
Addon is a item that can be purchased to enable additional features within a marketplace app.
These can be either Consumables, Non-Consumables or Subscriptions.

v1AddonResponse.title: Response message for requests that return a single addon

nextCursor.title: The cursor to send with the next request if there are more results to be loaded

hasMore.title: Indicates whether or not there are more results to be loaded

v1AddonsListResponse.title: Response message for a request that returns multiple addons

appId.title: The app ID that the edition is for

editionId.title: The unique ID of the edition

billingId.title: The Billing ID (SKU) of the edition

usesResellerMarketing.title: Indicates whether or not the edition uses reseller marketing

releaseType.title: The release state of the marketing data

rules.title: A list of rules, if one of the rules returns true the requirement is satisfied

childrenAppIds.title: A list of child apps that are dependant on this app

v1AppRequirement.title:
If an app is deactivated all of its add-ons (children) and dependent products will have to be checked to see if they still have an
app that satisfies their requirements, otherwise the dependent apps might also have to be deactivated 
as part of the original deactivation [see `GetAppsToDeactivateUponDeactivation` rpc]
if ONE of the rules is satisfied any errors will be tossed out and [the `CanActivate` rpc] will return nil
if ALL of the rules return errors, [the `CanActivate` rpc] response will list the app_ids that failed the requirement

v1AppResponse.title: General container for returning an application

id.description: The primary identifier for a AppVendor.

reportingCode.title: The financial reporting code associated to an AppVendor

v1AppVendor.description: AppVendor represents the Basic data to unify vendors items.

v1ApprovalProcess.description:
- APPROVAL_PROCESS_VENDASTA: Vendasta Marketplace Admin must approve changes to an app before they are visible throughout the platform
This is intended for Vendasta Quality gating items that are visible to a large number of partners
 - APPROVAL_PROCESS_VENDOR: A vendor can approve changes to an app without Vendasta intervention. This allows a vendor to push their edits
throughout the platform. This is intended for apps distributed to a smaller subset of partners, to avoid the delay
of waiting for Vendasta Quality gating
v1ApprovalProcess.title: The types of Approval Processes for an app

appId.title: The ID of the app that the addon will be updated for

appId.title: the id of the app to approve

currencyCode.title: currency code according to ISO-4217, e.g. 'USD', 'CAD', 'BRL', etc

v1BillingProcess.description:
- BILLING_PROCESS_NO_BILLING: App is not billed for in the billing system
 - BILLING_PROCESS_VENDASTA_BILLING: App is billed for in the billing system
v1BillingProcess.title: The types of Billing Process for an app

v1IdentifiedPublicKey.description:
IdentifiedPublicKey The identified public keys are considered "identified" because they have an id/key
associated with them that identifies a user or purpose for using that particular key instead of the default one,
for being  able to identify the callers of the API. It could be a backend service, a particular user or admin
for an app, etc.

vendorIds.title:
The list of vendor IDs to get the apps for.
These are in the form "VENDOR-XXXXXXX".
Vendor IDs can be retrieved by calling List in the Vendor service

includeAddons.description:
Controls whether apps AND addons should be returned or not.
NOTE: Only addons that have their vendor ID set to one of vendor_ids will be returned if this is true.
      This DOES NOT cause all addons of all returned apps to be fetched as an app and its addon can belong to different vendors.

cursor.title: The cursor returned from a previous call to ListAppsForVendors. Should be empty on the initial request

pageSize.title: The number of items to return

fieldMask.description: Which fields on the Marketplace App to return. A null field mask will return all fields.

v1ListAppsForVendorIDsRequest.title: ListAppsForVendorIDsRequest is used to get the list of apps (and optionally addons) that belong to a given vendor(s)

apps.title: The list of apps (including addons) that were requested

cursor.title: A pointer to the next set of responses. For use in a subsequent call to ListAppsForVendors

hasMore.title:
Indicates if there are more results available. If true, cursor should be used in the next ListAppsForVendorsRequest to ensure
you get the correct set of results

v1ListAppsForVendorIDsResponse.title: ListAppsForVendorIDsResponse is the response for ListAppsForVendors

cursor.description: the position to get the frame of data based on a set of filters and the search term.

pageSize.description: the size of the frame of data to receive in the response.

fieldMask.title:
The fields to return in the response for each application. If field masks are not passed, all fields
will be returned

filter.description: If filter is supplied, the options will be applied as an 'and' operation.

appType.description: The type of the applications to return in the final set.

releaseType.title: The release of the applications to return in the final set

filterTerm.description:
filter_term is the used as a regular expression pattern to filter applications against names and appIds.
If the filter term isn't specified, no filtering is performed.

state.description: The app state to be included in the returned results. Will default to Published (filtering out those in Draft).

appIds.title: List of app IDs to list editions for

appEditions.title: The list of requested app editions

cursor.title: Cursor should be supplied from the last response to load the next results

pageSize.description: The number of results to retrieve, max size and default is 100.

cursor.title: Cursor to use to request the next page

hasMore.title: Indicates if there is more items on a subsequent page

vendorId.description: Vendor ID represents the vendor's unique ID.

pageSize.title: Number of required product candidates to return

cursor.title: Current position to fetch the summaries from

nextCursor.description: The cursor for the next list request.

keySellingPoints.title: Reseller marketing information: key selling points

orderForm.title: Order form: fields in the order form

activationMessage.title: Order form: message shown to users upon activating the app

separateOrderForms.title: Order form: should a multi-activatable app/addon use a separate order form for each activation

commonFormRequiredFields.title: Order form: required common form fields

usesPostBillingOrderForm.title: Order form: whether or not the order form is to be used post-billing

uploadUrl.title: Deprecated: For file upload fields this is where we upload and store the file

prefix.title: For textbox fields, this string will be displayed in front of the textbox

suffix.title: For textbox fields, this string will be displayed behind the textbox

regexValidator.title: A regex string used to validate a fields answer

regexErrorMessage.title: The error message displayed if the regex_validator does not match the answer

useWebhookValidator.title: Indicates if this field will call out to the order_form_validator_webhook_url under Integration

allowMultiples.description:
The following 3 options are for dropdowns that allow you to choose multiple options
Whether or not to allow multiple choices.

allowDuplicates.description: If you should be able to choose the same option twice.

maxChoices.title: The maximum number of choices you can make

forOfficeUseOnly.title: if this is true the field will not be shown to end users

officeEditableOnly.title: if this is true the field will not be editable by end users

v1OrderFormField.title: Field asking user for information when they try to activate the app

v1ProductCost.title: DEPRECATED: This message is associated with a deprecated RPC

appId.title: the id of the app to publish

id.title: the vendor ID to remove the application from

appId.title: the App ID to remove from the vendor

v1RemoveAppIDRequest.title: RemoveAppIDRequest disconnects an app from a specified vendor. This is expected to be an uncommon operation

v1RemoveAppIDResponse.description: RemoveAppIDResponse shows the final state of the vendor after the remove operation is completed.

appId.title: The ID of the app/addon to request a review for

v1RequestAppReviewRequest.title: request to request an app review

whitelist.title: Features that this app requires to be activated

v1RequiredFeatures.title: RequiredFeatures holds a list of features a partner needs before activating an app

appId.title: The ID of the app to restore

v1RestoreAppRequest.description: request message structure for restoring deleted app.

country.title: Allowed or not allowed countries for this app/addon

requiredFeatures.title: Features that this app requires to be activated

requiredBusinessData.title: Business profile fields that this app requires to populated before activation

v1Restrictions.title: Restrictions is used to specify any restrictions on an app/addon for a given field

appIds.title: A list of apps, where each app must be active on the account before the app that this rule applies to can be activated

requiredEditions.title: A list of editions, where each edition must be active on the account before the app that this rule applies to can be activated

v1Rule.description:
Rule: a set of possible criteria an app needs to satisfy in order to be eligible for activation
The requirements for all fields in the Rule must be met.

v1State.description:
- STATE_INVALID: STATE_INVALID means that the state has not been set
 - STATE_DRAFT: STATE_DRAFT means that the app is not visible in Partner Center
 - STATE_PUBLISHED: STATE_PUBLISHED means that the app is now visible in Partner Center
v1State.title: State tells which state (i.e., draft or published) of an app

v1StateFilterOptions.title:
- STATE_FILTER_OPTIONS_PUBLISHED: filter for published
 - STATE_FILTER_OPTIONS_STATE_DRAFT: filter for draft
 - STATE_FILTER_OPTIONS_STATE_ALL: No filter, return all states

appId.title: The ID of the app to suspend

v1SuspendAppRequest.description: request message structure for suspending an app.

appId.title: The ID of the app that the addon will be updated for

v1UnapproveAddonRequest.title: UnapproveAddonRequest is issued to change the approved boolean of an addon to be false

appId.title: the id of the app to approve
The ID of the app to unsuspend

v1UnsuspendAppRequest.description: request message structure for unsuspending a suspended app.

appId.title: the id of the app or addon to update

approvalProcess.title: the approval process which is to be set on the app

billingProcess.title: the billing process which is to be set on the app

v1UpdateAppApprovalAndBillingSettingsReq.title: Request to update app approval and billing settings

appId.title: The ID of the app to update

categoryIds.description: List of categories for the app.

v1UpdateAppCategoriesRequest.description: request message structure for updating app's categories.

appId.title: The id of the app to update

usesFulfillmentIntegration.title: Indicates whether or not the app uses fulfillment integration settings

appId.title: The id of the app to update

price.title: Product information: price stored as cents

currency.title:
Product information: currency
currency is deprecated, non USD values will result in prices not being saved

allowPriceNegotiation.title: Whether or not a partner can negotiate the price of the app

gdprCompliant.title: Whether or not the app is GDPR compliant

fieldMask.title: field_mask to indicate which fields to update. If missing, update them all

preventPriceConversionBetweenCurrencies.title: Indicates whether or not we should undergo conversion with currency or stay constant (I.e. convert USD to CAD, or use same price regardless)

suggestedRetailPrice.title: Product Information: suggested retial price as cents

country.title: List of country restrictions for the app

commitment.title: Information about the required commitment for the app

multipleActivations.title: Indicates whether or not the app supports multiple activations per account

usesEditions.title: Indicates whether or not the app uses editions

discoverable.title: Is the addon discoverable within marketplace

editionIds.title: The list of editions for the app

state.title: Whether the app is in draft or published (as in visible in Partner Center) state

usesCustomPricing.title: Indicates whether or not the app supports custom pricing

deliveryMethod.title: Indicates how the customer uses the app (e.g., product/service)

fees.title: List of generic fees for this app

suggestedRetailSetupFee.title: The MSRP setup fee in cents

appId.title: The id of the app to update the integration information for

publicKey.title: The public key of the app

reserveIdUrl.title: Reserve Url: for calling out to applications to let them know an activation is coming, but not guaranteed yet

activationRequiresApproval.title: Does the app require vendor approval to be activated

contactWebhookUrl.title: Contact Url: webhook url for creating/editing a contact

partnerSettingsWebhookUrl.title: Webhook url: for partner specific settings that are applied to the app

partnerContactRecipients.title: Partner contact recipients: a list of vendors contact information

usesIntegration.title: Indicates whether or not the app uses integration settings

orderFormValidatorWebhookUrl.title: Webhook url: for dynamic form validation from the vendor

allowWhiteLabeling.title: Indicates the Vendor is allowing the app to be white labelled

customerWebhookUrl.title: Customer Url: webhook url for creating/editing a customers

sendCancelationNotifications.title: Indicates whether to send emails when the app is cancelled or uncancelled

appLevelHasAdminDashboard.title:
Indicates to the user if the app has a vendor dashboard
When enabled the reseller will be able to choose to let their admins access the vendor dashboard

hideFromClientDashboard.title:
When enabled the product will not appear within the client's dashboard
This can be used in conjunction with the app_level_has_admin_dashboard to only allow the resellers users to access the vendor dashboard

appId.title: App Id: the id of the app

usesMarketingInformation.title: Indicates whether or not the app uses marketing information

appId.title: App Id: the id of the app

usesOrderForm.title: Uses order form: whether or not the app requires extra fields to be filled out

orderForm.title: Order form: the extra fields to be filled out upon activation

usesActivationSpecificEntryUrl.title: Uses activation specific entry urls for fullfillment

applicationUrl.description: Application URL to be used when the application gets launched in business center.

appId.title: The id of the app to update

entryUrl.title: SSO url: Entry point for the application

sessionUrl.title: SSO url: Session code generation url

usesSsoIntegration.title: Indicates whether or not the app uses sso integration settings

appId.title: The id of the app to update

trialsEnabled.title: boolean indicating whether on not trials are enabled for the app

duration.title: default duration of the trial, in days

endOfTrialAction.title: action to take at end of trial

fieldMask.description: Supported updates for name, and description only at this time.

appId.title: The app the edition belongs to

name.title: The new name of the edition

pricing.title: The pricing information for the edition

appId.title: The app the editions belong to

partnerId.title: The associated Partner ID of the vendor

reportingCode.title: The financial reporting code of the vendor

v1UpdateVendorRequest.description: UpdateVendorRequest updates the basic information of a vendor. App Association is expected to be done separately.

appId.title: The app ID that the edition marketing is for

editionId.title: The edition ID that the edition marketing is for

usesResellerMarketing.title: Indicates whether or not the edition uses reseller marketing

v1UpsertEditionsMarketingRequest.title: Request to create a new marketing info or insert against an existing marketing info

itemId.title: unique primary identifier of the item

sellerWhitelabelName.title: whitelabel item name set by seller

iconUrl.title: url pointing to owner set icon

sellerWhitelabelIconUrl.title: url pointing to whitelabel icon set by seller

isSuspended.title: flag indicating whether the item has been suspended in the marketplace

isMultiactivatable.title: flag indicating whether or not the item can be activated on a single account more than once

requiredCountries.title: list of countries the item is available in, if the item can only be purchased for a consumer in certain countries

requiredItems.title: list of items required for the purchase of this item

deliveryMethod.title: method by which the item is delivered (ie SaaS product or service)

enabledDate.title: date at which the item was enabled by the seller

categories.title: the categories that the item has been added to

usesEditions.title: flag indicating if the item uses editions

orderFormEnabled.title:
order_form_enabled determines whether or not the application requires an order form submission to be successfully activated
on an account

multipleActivationsEnabled.title: allows_multiple_activations determines whether or not multiple instance of this app can be active at the same time for a user

activationSpecificUrlEnabled.title: activation_specific_url_enabled determines whether or not the application requires an activation specific entry url

separateOrderForms.title: separate_order_forms determines whether or not the application requires separate order forms for each activation

requiredBusinessData.title: Business profile fields that this app requires to populated before activation

suspended.title: suspended is a timestamp after which the app is suspended, and cannot be activated

countryRestrictions.title: Allowed or not allowed countries for this app/addon

appRestrictions.description: The apps and (potentially) their editions that must be active for this app.

v2App.description:
The base application definition. Note that the data for the different sections will be represented based on passed.
projection filters for the App Service RPC set.

v2AppKey.description:
The full identifier for a marketplace app. Note that if the edition_id is left empty, the application that is requested (or fetched)
will just be the base app configuration with no edition overrides.

quantity.title: Optional - default is 1. It is expected only apps / addons capable of multi activation will be given a quantity

allowSelfServeForPartner.title: The partner can SSO directly into the app

v2AppLevelAdminDashboard.title: The settings to control how an app can be accessed directly

appLevelAdminDashboardEnabledForPartnerC.title: boolean indicating whether on not AppLevelAdminDashboardEnabled are enabled for the app

appId.title: id of App prices were returned for

displayOverride.title: options for display prices (ie "Contact Sales" rather than a price amount)

billingConfiguration.title: additional options for handling certain billing scenarios

pricesForEditions.title: map of prices to editionIDs (one element for non-editioned apps)

appId.title: id of App prices were returned for

pricesForContexts.title: map of app prices for pricing contexts

requiredAppIds.description: A set of apps that must be active, and is not edition specific.

requiredEditionIds.description: A set of apps that must be active, and is edition specific.

v2AppRestrictions.description: A set of conditions that must be satisfied for the app to be activated.

appId.title: ID of the app

v2AppSettings.title: AppSettings are the partner configurable settings of an app

scope.title:
scope of the tag, ie:
scope = /             global data
scope = /<pid>        partner-specific data
scope = /<pid>/<mid>  market/storefront-specific data

value.title: tag id or name, ie: reputation, SEO

appId.title: id of the app

autoActivateByDefault.title: Should the app be activated on account create

editionId.title: Edition that should be auto activated on account create

v2AutoActivation.title: Auto Activation details of an app

applicationUrl.description:
The URL the user would be redirected to, when launching the product from business center.
It would be the frontend's logic that will determine the precedence among the three URLs
to be used when launching an app (application url, sso url or activation url).

allowWhiteLabeling.title: Indicates the Vendor is allowing the app to be white labelled

appLevelHasAdminDashboard.title:
Indicates to the user if the app has a vendor dashboard
When enabled the reseller will be able to choose to let their admins access the vendor dashboard

hideFromClientDashboard.title:
When enabled the product will not appear within the client's dashboard
This can be used in conjunction with the app_level_has_admin_dashboard to only allow the resellers users to access the vendor dashboard

v2BasicIntegration.description: Basic integration settings/information for an app.

enabled.title: Indicate whether the override should be used

v2Branding.title: The settings to control partner configurable app information

appId.description: The app ID of the dependent child.

itemIds.title: itemIDs of all the dependent items

discountType.description: Discount type eg. fixed_amount, percent_amount, etc.

customerId.title: (OPTIONAL) The identifier of the customer the discount is applied to

v2EditionChange.description: The settings to control what to do on edition change.

editions.title: The possible editions for this app

usesEditions.title: Indicates whether or not the app uses editions

editionRequired.title: Indicates if the requirement can be satisfied by the specified edition or any edition

v2EditionUpgradeAction.description: - EDITION_UPGRADE_ACTION_UNSET: If left unset it will default to create order.

description.description: A description of the application. This field could contain HTML/CSS tags/selectors.

keySellingPoints.description: A list of specific points used to entice an enduser to purchase the application.

faqs.description: A list of enqueries an enduser might ask.

fileUrls.description:
A list of urls for different files containing additional marketing information for the applications.
The intended use for this field is to surface urls for document file types like .pdf and .doc, however
this field can be used for any file type.

screenshotUrls.description:
A list of urls for different screenshots showcasing things like how the application is used and
its value proposition.

billingId.title: The billing id of the app (sku)

setupFee.title: additional setup fee for this price

pricingRules.title: rules for how to price this unit

instancePrice.title: instance price is related to the product's effective cost, considering quantity and possible discounts or tiered pricing

fees.title: fees are the fees that are applied as part of the price

pricesForFrequencies.title: list of prices for frequencies (ie monthly, yearly)

appId.title: The Application ID

defaultExternalFormUrl.title: Form to include on the fulfillment order

isEnabled.title: flag controlling if a config is enabled or not

fulfillmentForm.description: Shared Proto from MarketplaceApp to store a legacy Form Builder config.

usesFulfillmentForm.description: flag controlling if a Fulfillment Order has a Fulfillment Order Form attached to it when created.

appId.title: ID of the app

disableFallback.title: Indicates whether to disable fallback to partner/vendor level app settings

itemId.title: The ID of the item for which to retrieve the dependency tree

dependencyTree.title: The dependency tree for the given item

appId.title: ID of the app

v2GetMultiAppDataRequest.title: get the data for the given appIds in a market scope

apps.title: List of the apps asked for

v2GetMultiAppDataResponse.title: List the appIds data asked for

itemIds.title: The IDs of the items for which to retrieve dependencies

dependentItems.title: The dependencies for the given items

appIds.title: Deprecated (use item_ids): list of apps to return prices for

pricingContexts.title: list of contexts the price is being requested for (ie msrp, wholesale)

partnerId.title: id of the partner, only required for certain pricing contexts

marketId.title: id of the market, only required for certain pricing contexts

filterOptions.title: filter_options the requester wants to hydrate on the response

requestedApps.title: Deprecated (use RequestedItems): list of requested apps to be hydrated based on the filter_options

businessId.title: id of the business that an item is being sold to, only required for certain pricing contexts

itemIds.title: list of items to return prices for (optional until we phase out app_ids field)

requestedItems.title: list of requested items to be hydrated based on the filter_options

appPrices.title: list of pricing context prices for apps

userId.title: required - The user_id to obtain the purchase link for (not subjectId)

businessId.title: required - The business (account group) to obtain the purchase link for

appKeysWithQuantity.title: required - The apps we want to provide a link to purchase for complete with quantity

purchaseAcceptedNextUrl.description: required - Where the user will be redirected to after the purchase is successful.

purchaseDeclinedNextUrl.title: required - Where the user will be redirected to if they decline the purchase

purchaseLink.description:
The purchase_link that can be used to direct the user to the purchase page.
Will only be provided if purchase_allowed is true.

purchaseAllowed.title:
Whether the user can actually perform the purchase.
If this returns false, the client should display generic "contact admin" content
Reasons a user may not be able to perform the purchase can be found here:
 https://vendasta.jira.com/wiki/spaces/RD/pages/1609597263/Purchase+Link+Exposed+to+Vendors#Implementation

upgradeDialogContent.title: The upgrade dialog content that was just got

id.description: The unique ID of the item.

editionId.title: The ID of the edition of the item

values.title: list of values for the kind

v2KindValues.title: list of the kind/values of the app

ownerPartnerId.description: The partner ID of the owner.

includeSuspended.description:
Whether suspended items should be included.
Defaults to false.

A country that an ActivatableItem must be available in
If not specificed, no country restriction is applied

The type of items to return
If not specified, app and add-on types are returned

A required item that an ActivatableItem must have
If not specified, no required item is applied

The ActivatableItem has a custom order form
If not specified, no order form filter is applied

The types of items to return

Slash-delimited scope path, determines whitelabeling and access privileges

v2LmiCategory.description:
Definition of the local marketing indices supported by the marketplace. Note that this field
is only intended for marketing information. It does not define the functionality an application
would provide.

usesCustomPricing.title: Indicates whether or not the app supports custom pricing

max.title: maximum number of units to get this price (-1 represents no limit)

min.title: minimum number of units to get this price

appId.title: ID of the app

fieldMask.title: FieldMask for omitting values on update. If missing, update them all

appSettings.title: The App Settings that was just created

upgradeDialogContent.title: Upgrade dialog content to be replaced

appId.title: (app/addon/package) id of App prices to be hydrated

quantity.title: app/addon/package quantity to calculate the effective cost

v2RequestedApp.title: TODO: rename this to RequestedItem once we've replaced all usages of requested_apps field

itemId.title: unique identifier of the required item

name.title: whitelabel name of the required item set by seller

enabled.description:
enabled determines whether or not the application requires the pre-condition of an active parent on an
account before the activation of itself.
enabled determines whether or not the applicaiton requires sso for end users to access its' functionality.

entryUrl.description:
The URL the user would be redirected to, when launching the product from business center client. Please note that
not all applications have sso configuration.

v2SSOIntegration.description: The integration required for SSOing into the application.

scope.title:
scope of the tag, ie:
scope = /             global data
scope = /<pid>        partner-specific data
scope = /<pid>/<mid>  market/storefront-specific data

value.title: tag id or name, ie: reputation, SEO

editionName.description:
The name of the edition for the application. This field is only applicable if the AppKey
contains an edition id.

iconUrl.description: A url for the icon representing the app.

tagline.description: A short and snappy slogan to represent what the app does.

bannerImageUrl.description: The URL for a banner image. This image is intended to represent the application in certain types of visualizations.

lmiCategories.description:
The local marketing index categories the product falls in. For example if the lmi category is `advertising`, that
means that the app will provide services or functionality that effects the advertising of a SMB.

v2SharedMarketingInformation.description: SharedMarketingInformation is to be consumed by all user types in the platform.

v2SortDirection.description: The directions that a result set can be sorted in.

value.title: tag id or name, ie: reputation, SEO

tags.description: list of tags to be attached to a resource ID (app ID).

appId.description: list if resource IDs (app IDs) to which the tags will be attached.

allowSelfServe.title: The SMB can, without Partner approval, activate this App as a trial

v2Trial.title: The settings to control how trials behave

pricesForCurrencies.title: map of prices for currency codes

tags.description: list of tags to be removed from a resource ID (app ID).

appId.description: list if resource IDs (app IDs) from which the tags will be removed.

appId.title: ID of the app

titleText.description: The title text of the upgrade dialog.

sellingPoints.description: The selling points of the upgrade dialog.

imageUrl.description: The image URL of the upgrade dialog.

buttonText.description: The button text of the upgrade dialog.

imageFileName.description: The image file name of the upgrade dialog.

v2UpgradeDialogContent.description: UpgradeDialogContent are the partner configurable content of the upgrade dialog.

paths.description: The set of field mask paths.

vendastatypesFieldMask.title: `FieldMask` represents a set of symbolic field paths, for example:

cursor.title: cursor can be passed to retrieve the next page of results keyed by the cursor

pageSize.title: page_size specifies the number of items to return in the next page

nextCursor.title: A cursor that can be provided to retrieve the next page of results

hasMore.title: Whether or not more results exist

totalResults.title: The total number of results. This is not supported on all paged apis and will be 0 if it is not supported
